content: उग्र {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [उच्-रन् गश्चांतादेशः <ls>Uṇ. 2. 28</ls>] {@--1@} Fierce, cruel, ferocious, savage (as a look &c.); °दर्शनः having a fierce or cruel look. {@--2@} Formidable, terrific, frightful, fearful; सिंहनिपातमुग्रं <ls>R. 2. 60</ls>; <ls>Bg. 11. 30</ls>; <ls>Ms. 6. 75</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">12. 75</ls>; °दंतः, °नासिकः &c. {@--3@} Powerful, mighty, strong, violent, intense; उग्रातपां वेलां <ls>Ś. 3.</ls> intensely hot; उग्रशोकां <ls>Me. 113</ls> v.l. {@--4@} Sharp, pungent, hot. {@--5@} High, noble. {@--6@} Angry, passionate, wrathful. {@--7@} Ready to do any work, industrious. --ग्रः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva or Rudra. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a mixed tribe, descendant of a Kṣatriya father and Śūdra mother (his business being to catch or kill animals dwelling in holes, such as snakes; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 10. 9</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 10.">13</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 10.">15.</ls>). {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a tree शोभांजनवृक्ष. {@--4@} A group of five asterisms; their names are: -- पूर्वाफाल्गुनी, पूर्वाषाढा, पूर्वाभाद्रपदा, मघा and भरणी. {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of a country called Kerala (Modern Malabar). {@--6@} The sentiment called रौद्र. {@--7@} Wind. --ग्रा {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of different plants; वचा, यवानी, धन्याक. {@--2@} A cruel woman. --ग्री A kind of being belonging to the class of demons. --ग्रं {@--1@} A certain deadly poison, the root of Aconitum Ferox (वत्सनाभविषं). {@--2@} Wrath, anger.
